articles.headline: Online Tools to Shop for Doctors Snag on Health Care’s Complexity
articles.snippet: These services aim to create sophisticated shoppers for medical care, but even when people have access to new information, they might not use it.
articles.abstract: These services aim to create sophisticated shoppers for medical care, but even when people have access to new information, they might not use it.
articles.lead_paragraph: Need a dermatologist? Today, online tools can show you which doctors are in your plan’s network as well as rank them by the likely cost of a visit.

articles.headline: Defying China, Hong Kong Bookseller Describes Detention
articles.snippet: Lam Wing-kee, whose Hong Kong bookstore sold gossipy books about China’s leadership, says he was detained at the border by captors who wanted customers’ details.
articles.abstract: Lam Wing-kee, whose Hong Kong bookstore sold gossipy books about China’s leadership, says he was detained at the border by captors who wanted customers’ details.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Blindfolded and handcuffed, the bookseller was abducted from Hong Kong’s border with mainland China and taken to a cell, where he would spend five months in solitary confinement, watched 24 hours a day by a battery of Chinese guards.
articles.byline: By Alan Wong, Michael Forsythe and Andrew Jacobs

articles.headline: Microsoft-LinkedIn Deal Ignites Twitter Speculation
articles.snippet: Wishful thinking among Twitter investors aside, there are not many obvious buyers for the social media network.
articles.abstract: Wishful thinking among Twitter investors aside, there are not many obvious buyers for the social media network.

articles.headline: In Orlando, a Son of a Muslim Immigrant Rushed to Heal Pain Caused by Another
articles.snippet: Even as he spent hours repairing gun shot wounds, Dr. Joseph Ibrahim could not escape the parallels between his background and the gunman’s.
articles.abstract: Even as he spent hours repairing gun shot wounds, Dr. Joseph Ibrahim could not escape the parallels between his background and the gunman’s.
articles.lead_paragraph: ORLANDO, Fla. — When Dr. Joseph Ibrahim heard that the attack at the Pulse nightclub may have been linked to terrorism, he caught himself fearing any kind of link to his own Muslim, Middle-Eastern roots.

articles.headline: Redstone Moves to Replace Five Viacom Directors, Escalating Battle
articles.snippet: The new directors are believed to be aligned with Sumner Redstone’s daughter, Shari, who has publicly opposed the current Viacom chief executive.
articles.abstract: The new directors are believed to be aligned with Sumner Redstone’s daughter, Shari, who has publicly opposed the current Viacom chief executive.
articles.lead_paragraph: Philippe P. Dauman’s days as the chief executive of Viacom may be numbered — unless court battles go his way.

articles.headline: 51 U.S. Diplomats Urge Strikes Against Assad in Syria
articles.snippet: An internal memo, critical of Obama administration policy, says military action is necessary to stop violations of a cease-fire in the civil war.
articles.abstract: An internal memo, critical of Obama administration policy, says military action is necessary to stop violations of a cease-fire in the civil war.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — More than 50 State Department diplomats have signed an internal memo sharply critical of the Obama administration’s policy in Syria, urging the United States to carry out military strikes against the government of President Bashar al-Assad to stop its persistent violations of a cease-fire in the country’s five-year-old civil war.

articles.headline: An Unlikely Savior Emerges to Help Endangered Republicans: George W. Bush
articles.snippet: The former president has largely stayed away from politics. But he is deeply bothered by Donald J. Trump’s inflammatory talk.
articles.abstract: The former president has largely stayed away from politics. But he is deeply bothered by Donald J. Trump’s inflammatory talk.
articles.lead_paragraph: After eight years of largely abstaining from politics, former President George W. Bush is throwing himself into an effort to save his party’s most vulnerable senators, including several whose re-election campaigns have been made more difficult by Donald J. Trump’s presence at the top of the ticket.
articles.byline: By Maggie Haberman and Jonathan Martin

articles.headline: An Expensive Law Degree, and No Place to Use It
articles.snippet: Thousands of debt-ridden law school graduates highlight a once unthinkable question: Should their law schools close?
articles.abstract: Thousands of debt-ridden law school graduates highlight a once unthinkable question: Should their law schools close?
articles.lead_paragraph: VALPARAISO, Ind. — By most measures, John Acosta is a law school success story. He graduated from Valparaiso University Law School — a well-established regional school here in northwestern Indiana — in the top third of his class this past December, a semester ahead of schedule. He passed the bar exam on his first try in February.

articles.headline: A Hacking of More Than $50 Million Dashes Hopes in the World of Virtual Currency
articles.snippet: The project, known as the Decentralized Autonomous Organization, is raising broader questions about the security and viability of virtual currencies like Ether and Bitcoin.
articles.abstract: The project, known as the Decentralized Autonomous Organization, is raising broader questions about the security and viability of virtual currencies like Ether and Bitcoin.
articles.lead_paragraph: A hacker on Friday siphoned more than $50 million of digital money away from an experimental virtual currency project that had been billed as the most successful crowdfunding venture ever — taking with him not just a third of the venture’s money but also the hopes and dreams of thousands of participants who wanted to prove the safety and security of digital currency.

articles.headline: The Money Letter That Every Parent Should Write
articles.snippet: A good, soulful letter can become a family keepsake and should include a list of crucial habits and the tangible things that have helped the family.
articles.abstract: A good, soulful letter can become a family keepsake and should include a list of crucial habits and the tangible things that have helped the family.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Money Talk, capital “M” and capital “T,” is overrated. As with the Sex Talk, children can sense that one is coming. And if they get antsy, your words will go in one ear and out the other.
